data.title: GRAMMY-Nominated Texas Artist Pat Green Coming to Texarkana
data.meta_description: GRAMMY-Nominated Texas Artist Pat Green Coming to Texarkana
data.text:
The 2024 Texarkana Solarbration just got better with a concert from GRAMMY-nominated artist Pat Green kicking off the weekend.

The concert will be at Crossties Event Venue on Friday, April 5, 2024. One of the original founding fathers of Texas Country has been performing for more than 25 years since the release of his first album, Dancehall Dreamer. Green has been living the dream on the road touring and shows no signs of quitting anytime soon.

Pat Green took the Texas Country radio by storm during his earlier years with 12 Number 1 singles, eventually landing him on the Top 5 Billboard charts with hits like "Wave on Wave," which led to selling two million albums worldwide and a string of Top 10 singles on the Billboard Country Music Charts.

Greenâ€™s current album, Miles and Miles of You is his 14th studio album and his first in almost 7 years. the album was recorded just outside Austin, Texas. Green feels like this album represents who he is as an artist, songwriter, and musician.

Earlier this month, Pat Green received an honor for his charitable organization for humanitarian work at the Arlington Music Award show in the Dallas-Fort Worth Metroplex.

For more information on Pat Greem visit his website or Facebook page.

For tickets to the Texarkana show go to Crosstie's Facebook page or purchase here.

Don't miss Pat Green in concert on Friday, April 5, at Crossties with opening act local artist Lane Bricker beginning at 7 p.m.
